metadata.name: Github Push Protection Disabled
metadata.comment: Detects if the push protection feature is disabled for an organization, enterprise, repositories or custom pattern rules.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM vulnerability_finding WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(LOWER(action)) in ('business_secret_scanning_custom_pattern_push_protection\.disabled', 'business_secret_scanning_push_protection\.disable', 'business_secret_scanning_push_protection\.disabled_for_new_repos', 'org\.secret_scanning_custom_pattern_push_protection_disabled', 'org\.secret_scanning_push_protection_disable', 'org\.secret_scanning_push_protection_new_repos_disable', 'repository_secret_scanning_custom_pattern_push_protection\.disabled'))

output.summary: Detects if the push protection feature is disabled for an organization, enterprise, repositories or custom pattern rules.

metadata.objective: False positive: Allowed administrative activities. References: https://docs.github.com/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/code-security/secret-scanning/push-protection-for-repositories-and-organizations, https://thehackernews.com/2024/03/github-rolls-out-default-secret.html
